result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon L. Hayes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon L. Hayes was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Brandon L. Hayes was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $650.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
See repayment provisions noted above for the Fine.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

16CM-6- and 16TR-353 - Both Cases Called @ 3:08 PM: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD files Atty Auth and Plea QN with the Court.  Court will proceed with Atty Authorization.  Joint Agreement recited by ADA.   SPD confirms resolution.  DA Blader joins hearing.  Amended Complaint Stated.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Ct 2 Plea RCS w/Minor Pass:  NC tendered.  Ct 3 POP:  NC tendered.  Court receives pleas and enters JOC to each count.  Ct 1 dismissed outright.  16TR-353 DRI.  Repeater Enh also dismissed attached to Ct 3.  SPD confirms Joint Recommendation.  The Court:  Follows Joint Recommendation.  Ct 2 - 17 days WCJ, Huber, GT no TS credit, Report 9/1/16;  $1555 Fine plus $42.50 blood draw fee - 60 DTP or PP - Bond to be applied; 14 mos DL Rev/IID/OWI assessment prior to relicensing.  Ct 3 Court Costs imposed.  DNA Sample already on file.
Status conference on July 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Brandon L. Hayes in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Stephen Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Status conference on April 28, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

2:38 pm cases called 16CM60 & 16TR353. Defendant Brandon L. Hayes in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he contacted SPD but has not received an answer from them. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Court reiterates previously ordered payments regarding counsel-first payment of $250 due one week from today and then payments of $50/month thereafter.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on April 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:18 PM: Defendant Brandon L. Hayes in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and requests SPD services.  Def is employed full time.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  If Def does not qualify, the Court will require a deposit be paid no later than 3/18/16 of $250.  Commencing 5/1/2016 a $50 per month payment plan to continue until further order.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Blood Draw Reimbursement - $42.50
